Instead of the moving horses and hussars' backs, he saw nothing before him but the mo- tionless earth and the stubble around him. There was warm blood under his arm. "No, I am wounded and the horse is killed." Rook tried to rise on his forelegs but fell back, pin- ning his rider's leg. Blood was flowing from his head; he struggled but could not rise. Rost6v also tried to rise but fell back, his sabretache having become entangled in the saddle. Where
